result.execSummary:
The defendant Taurean Dionte White was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misdemeanor Intimidation Of a Victim, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

All other court costs, fines, and surcharges are WAIVED due to inability to pay.

Any cash bail on deposit to apply and the remaining balance to be returned to the poster.

Defendant Taurean Dionte White appeared by video.  Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy appeared by video for Taurean Dionte White.  Prosecuting attorney Katie Bakunowicz for Mallory Davis appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Sentencing hearing held. Court VACATES the previous ordered sentence on 8/18/22. Court takes judicial notice of the arguments and analysis placed on the record on 8/18/22.

AS TO COUNT 1: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 141 DAYS in the House of Correction; with credit for 141 DAYS served.  A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
- All other court costs, fines, and surcharges are WAIVED due to inability to pay. 
- DNA surcharge due by: 8/18/23. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 

*The defendant is advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.

FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Taurean Dionte White in court with attorney Nicholas John Conrardy.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing hearing held.  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  

AS TO COUNT 1: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 175 DAYS in the House of Correction; with credit for 175 DAYS served.  A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
- All other court costs, fines, and surcharges are WAIVED due to inability to pay. 
- DNA surcharge due by: 8/18/23. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
- Any cash bail on deposit to apply and the remaining balance to be returned to the poster.

*The defendant is advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.

FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit

22RM035203  Actual Date Bond Posted with *SHERIFF
07/23/2022

Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy in court, defendant Taurean Dionte White not in court, in custody.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Bail Bond Hearing. Defendant not produced. Arguments heard as to bail. Court denied bail motion for todays purposes. Case remains calendared as previously set.

Defendant Taurean Dionte White in court with attorney Nicholas John Conrardy.  Defendant Taurean Dionte White in custody.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea hearing held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Court held colloquy with the defendant regarding his right to have an in-person hearing.  Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Defense counsel requests a bail/bond hearing. Court vacates the jury trial on 7/18/22. Case adjourned to Branch 29 for Sentencing.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury Instructions, filed.
Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights and Addendum, filed.

Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy in court, defendant Taurean Dionte White not in court, in custody.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a final pre-trial. Defense counsel requests a plea hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Plea hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Motions in Limine, received and filed.

Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy in court, defendant Taurean Dionte White not in court, in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case recalled to reschedule the SPEEDY final pre-trial and jury trial.   Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Expires: 8/5/22

Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy in court, defendant Taurean Dionte White not in court, in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy in court, defendant Taurean Dionte White not in court, in custody.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Status conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel was recently appointed and requests a scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Taurean Dionte White not in court, defendant in custody.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pre-trial conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. The PD's Office needs additional time to appoint counsel. Court orders matter adjourned for a status of counsel hearing in Branch 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Status conference scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with R.L.T
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Taurean Dionte White in court with attorney Charles Robert Roozen.  Defendant Taurean Dionte White in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Taurean Dionte White appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant has lower number case(s) pending.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
